alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 2:39PM AKST until March 10 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Northeast winds 25 to 35 mph, gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel may be difficult. Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Falling snow in combination with gusty winds may reduce visibilities to as low as one quarter mile or less at times through the early evening hours north of Toksook Bay. There is then anticipated to be a lull in the activity before another round of snow and blowing snow moves into the area after midnight and into the morning hours Thursday. With this second round of precipitation, some colder air is expected to move in at the surface causing temperatures to cool for places such as Bethel to Kipnuk to Toksook Bay while temperatures aloft still remain warm. The combination of the warm temperatures aloft and precipitation may allow for a period of freezing rain for these areas especially after midnight through Thursday morning. The dominant precipitation type is expected to be snow as the warm nose is expected to diminish rather quickly as colder air comes in but there exists the threat for some freezing rain. All precipitation should come to an end around 9 AM Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
